mandatedFeatures.feature: Settings page with model selection + custom API key
mandatedFeatures.description: Step 22: Settings Page with model picker (Claude + Kimi) and per-provider API key input. No AI Agent Consultation Tool.
mandatedFeatures.rationale: Users must provide their own keys and choose models. Kimi explicitly required for cheap testing.

mandatedFeatures.description: Step 23: Full session persistence with save/load dialogs, auto-save, session history, and fork/clone functionality.
mandatedFeatures.rationale: Research is multi-day work. Session management is table stakes for professional tools.

mandatedFeatures.description: Step 24: Rich card-based choice interfaces with AI-generated recommendations and confidence scores.
mandatedFeatures.rationale: Current steering is too textual. Cards with recommendations reduce cognitive load.

mandatedFeatures.description: Step 25: Prioritize sources by concepts and research traces, not individual URLs. Visual concept graph.
mandatedFeatures.rationale: URL-level prioritization misses the big picture. Researchers care about concepts and coverage.

mandatedFeatures.feature: Professional UX with complete app functionality
mandatedFeatures.description: Step 26: Keyboard shortcuts, context menus, drag-and-drop, undo/redo, export, print, onboarding, error handling.
mandatedFeatures.rationale: This is a professional tool, not a demo. All standard desktop app functionalities required.

mandatedFeatures.description: Step 27: VSCode One Dark Pro theme with specific color palette (#282c34 background, vibrant accents).
mandatedFeatures.rationale: One Dark Pro signals quality and attention to detail. Differentiates from amateur tools.

note: These are example mandates from TheResearcher project. Steps and features listed here are explicitly directed by the project owner. Codex must not raise scope/plan CRs against mandated steps. Technical correctness, safety, and code quality CRs remain valid.
